AssociateRoleToGroup.name: AssociateRoleToGroup
AssociateRoleToGroup.documentation: Associates a role with a group. Your AWS Greengrass core will use the role to access AWS cloud services. The role's permissions should allow Greengrass core Lambda functions to perform actions against the cloud.

AssociateServiceRoleToAccount.name: AssociateServiceRoleToAccount
AssociateServiceRoleToAccount.documentation: Associates a role with your account. AWS Greengrass will use the role to access your Lambda functions and AWS IoT resources. This is necessary for deployments to succeed. The role must have at least minimum permissions in the policy ''AWSGreengrassResourceAccessRolePolicy''.

CreateCoreDefinition.name: CreateCoreDefinition
CreateCoreDefinition.documentation: Creates a core definition. You may provide the initial version of the core definition now or use ''CreateCoreDefinitionVersion'' at a later time. AWS Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one AWS Greengrass core.

CreateCoreDefinitionVersion.name: CreateCoreDefinitionVersion
CreateCoreDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a core definition that has already been defined. AWS Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one AWS Greengrass core.

CreateDeviceDefinition.name: CreateDeviceDefinition
CreateDeviceDefinition.documentation: Creates a device definition. You may provide the initial version of the device definition now or use ''CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion.name: CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion
CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a device definition that has already been defined.

CreateFunctionDefinition.name: CreateFunctionDefinition
CreateFunctionDefinition.documentation: Creates a Lambda function definition which contains a list of Lambda functions and their configurations to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of Lambda functions and their configurations now, or use ''CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion'' later.

CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion.name: CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion
CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a Lambda function definition that has already been defined.

CreateGroup.name: CreateGroup
CreateGroup.documentation: Creates a group. You may provide the initial version of the group or use ''CreateGroupVersion'' at a later time.

CreateGroupCertificateAuthority.name: CreateGroupCertificateAuthority

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the new active CA ARN.

CreateGroupCertificateAuthority.documentation: Creates a CA for the group. If a CA already exists, it will rotate the existing CA.

CreateGroupVersion.name: CreateGroupVersion

output.documentation: Success. The response contains information about the group version.

CreateGroupVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a group which has already been defined.

CreateLoggerDefinition.name: CreateLoggerDefinition
CreateLoggerDefinition.documentation: Creates a logger definition. You may provide the initial version of the logger definition now or use ''CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion.name: CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion
CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a logger definition that has already been defined.

CreateResourceDefinition.name: CreateResourceDefinition
CreateResourceDefinition.documentation: Creates a resource definition which contains a list of resources to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of resources now, or use ''CreateResourceDefinitionVersion'' later.

CreateResourceDefinitionVersion.name: CreateResourceDefinitionVersion
CreateResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a resource definition that has already been defined.

CreateSoftwareUpdateJob.name: CreateSoftwareUpdateJob
CreateSoftwareUpdateJob.documentation: Creates a software update for a core or group of cores (specified as an IoT thing group.) Use this to update the OTA Agent as well as the Greengrass core software. It makes use of the IoT Jobs feature which provides additional commands to manage a Greengrass core software update job.

CreateSubscriptionDefinition.name: CreateSubscriptionDefinition
CreateSubscriptionDefinition.documentation: Creates a subscription definition. You may provide the initial version of the subscription definition now or use ''CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.name: CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion
CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a subscription definition which has already been defined.

DisassociateRoleFromGroup.name: DisassociateRoleFromGroup
DisassociateRoleFromGroup.documentation: Disassociates the role from a group.

DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount.name: DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount
DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount.documentation: Disassociates the service role from your account. Without a service role, deployments will not work.

GetAssociatedRole.name: GetAssociatedRole
GetAssociatedRole.documentation: Retrieves the role associated with a particular group.

GetConnectivityInfo.name: GetConnectivityInfo
GetConnectivityInfo.documentation: Retrieves the connectivity information for a core.

GetCoreDefinition.name: GetCoreDefinition
GetCoreDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a core definition version.

GetCoreDefinitionVersion.name: GetCoreDefinitionVersion
GetCoreDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a core definition version.

GetDeploymentStatus.name: GetDeploymentStatus

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the status of the deployment for the group.

GetDeploymentStatus.documentation: Returns the status of a deployment.

GetDeviceDefinition.name: GetDeviceDefinition
GetDeviceDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a device definition.

GetDeviceDefinitionVersion.name: GetDeviceDefinitionVersion
GetDeviceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a device definition version.

GetFunctionDefinition.name: GetFunctionDefinition
GetFunctionDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition, including its creation time and latest version.

GetFunctionDefinitionVersion.name: GetFunctionDefinitionVersion
GetFunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition version, including which Lambda functions are included in the version and their configurations.

GetGroupCertificateAuthority.name: GetGroupCertificateAuthority

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

GetGroupCertificateAuthority.documentation: Retreives the CA associated with a group. Returns the public key of the CA.

GetGroupCertificateConfiguration.name: GetGroupCertificateConfiguration

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

GetGroupCertificateConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves the current configuration for the CA used by the group.

GetGroupVersion.name: GetGroupVersion
GetGroupVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a group version.

GetLoggerDefinition.name: GetLoggerDefinition
GetLoggerDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a logger definition.

GetLoggerDefinitionVersion.name: GetLoggerDefinitionVersion
GetLoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a logger definition version.

GetResourceDefinition.name: GetResourceDefinition
GetResourceDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a resource definition, including its creation time and latest version.

GetResourceDefinitionVersion.name: GetResourceDefinitionVersion
GetResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a resource definition version, including which resources are included in the version.

GetServiceRoleForAccount.name: GetServiceRoleForAccount
GetServiceRoleForAccount.documentation: Retrieves the service role that is attached to your account.

GetSubscriptionDefinition.name: GetSubscriptionDefinition
GetSubscriptionDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a subscription definition.

GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.name: GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion
GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a subscription definition version.

ListCoreDefinitionVersions.name: ListCoreDefinitionVersions
ListCoreDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a core definition.

ListCoreDefinitions.name: ListCoreDefinitions
ListCoreDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of core definitions.

ListDeployments.name: ListDeployments

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the list of deployments for the given group.

ListDeployments.documentation: Returns a history of deployments for the group.

ListDeviceDefinitionVersions.name: ListDeviceDefinitionVersions
ListDeviceDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a device definition.

ListDeviceDefinitions.name: ListDeviceDefinitions
ListDeviceDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of device definitions.

ListFunctionDefinitionVersions.name: ListFunctionDefinitionVersions
ListFunctionDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a Lambda function definition.

ListFunctionDefinitions.name: ListFunctionDefinitions

output.documentation: Success. The response contains the IDs of all the Greengrass Lambda function definitions in this account.

ListFunctionDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of Lambda function definitions.

ListGroupCertificateAuthorities.name: ListGroupCertificateAuthorities

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

ListGroupCertificateAuthorities.documentation: Retrieves the current CAs for a group.

ListGroupVersions.name: ListGroupVersions

output.documentation: Success. The response contains the list of versions and metadata for the given group.

ListGroupVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a group.

ListLoggerDefinitionVersions.name: ListLoggerDefinitionVersions
ListLoggerDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a logger definition.

ListLoggerDefinitions.name: ListLoggerDefinitions
ListLoggerDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of logger definitions.

ListResourceDefinitionVersions.name: ListResourceDefinitionVersions
ListResourceDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a resource definition.

ListResourceDefinitions.name: ListResourceDefinitions

output.documentation: The IDs of all the Greengrass resource definitions in this account.

ListResourceDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of resource definitions.

ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions.name: ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions
ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a subscription definition.

ListSubscriptionDefinitions.name: ListSubscriptionDefinitions
ListSubscriptionDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of subscription definitions.

output.documentation: Success. The group's deployments were reset.

UpdateConnectivityInfo.name: UpdateConnectivityInfo
UpdateConnectivityInfo.documentation: Updates the connectivity information for the core. Any devices that belong to the group which has this core will receive this information in order to find the location of the core and connect to it.

UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration.name: UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration.documentation: Updates the Certificate expiry time for a group.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the AWS Greengrass group.

AssociatedAt.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the role ARN was associated with the group.

Id.documentation: The ID of the connectivity information.

PortNumber.documentation: The port of the Greengrass core. Usually 8883.

SyncShadow.documentation: If true, the core's local shadow is automatically synced with the cloud.

FunctionArn.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function.

Id.documentation: The ID of the Lambda function.

EncodingType.documentation: The expected encoding type of the input payload for the function. The default is ''json''.

Environment.documentation: The environment configuration of the function.

Executable.documentation: The name of the function executable.

MemorySize.documentation: The memory size, in KB, which the function requires.

Pinned.documentation: True if the function is pinned. Pinned means the function is long-lived and starts when the core starts.

Timeout.documentation: The allowed function execution time, after which Lambda should terminate the function. This timeout still applies to pinned lambdas for each request.

FunctionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the Lambda function.

AccessSysfs.documentation: If true, the Lambda function is allowed to access the host's /sys folder. Use this when the Lambda function needs to read device information from /sys.

ResourceAccessPolicies.documentation: A list of the resources, with their permissions, to which the Lambda function will be granted access. A Lambda function can have at most 10 resources.

Variables.documentation: Environment variables for the Lambda function's configuration.

FunctionConfigurationEnvironment.documentation: The environment configuration of the function.

Functions.documentation: A list of Lambda functions in this function definition version.

FunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a function definition version.

Message.documentation: A message containing information about the error.

AutoAddGroupOwner.documentation: If true, GreenGrass automatically adds the specified Linux OS group owner of the resource to the Lambda process privileges. Thus the Lambda process will have the file access permissions of the added Linux group.

GroupOwnerSetting.documentation: Group/owner related settings for local resources.

SourcePath.documentation: The local absolute path of the device resource. The source path for a device resource can refer only to a character device or block device under ''/dev''.

LocalDeviceResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a local device resource.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the lambda environment.

GroupOwnerSetting.documentation: Allows you to configure additional group privileges for the Lambda process. This field is optional.

SourcePath.documentation: The local absolute path of the volume resource on the host. The source path for a volume resource type cannot start with ''/proc'' or ''/sys''.

LocalVolumeResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a local volume resource.

Component.documentation: The component that will be subject to logging.

Space.documentation: The amount of file space, in KB, to use if the local file system is used for logging purposes.

Type.documentation: The type of log output which will be used.

LoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a logger definition version.

Permission.documentation: The type of permission a function has to access a resource.

AmznClientToken.documentation: A client token used to correlate requests and responses.

Force.documentation: If true, performs a best-effort only core reset.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the AWS Greengrass group.

Id.documentation: The resource ID, used to refer to a resource in the Lambda function configuration. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

Name.documentation: The descriptive resource name, which is displayed on the Greengrass console. Max length 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

ResourceDataContainer.documentation: A container of data for all resource types.

Permission.documentation: The permissions that the Lambda function has to the resource. Can be one of ''rw'' (read/write) or ''ro'' (read-only).

ResourceId.documentation: The ID of the resource. (This ID is assigned to the resource when you create the resource definiton.)

ResourceAccessPolicy.documentation: A policy used by the function to access a resource.

LocalDeviceResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define the local device resource.

LocalVolumeResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define the local volume resource.

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define an S3 machine learning resource.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.documentation: Attributes that define an SageMaker machine learning resource.

ResourceDataContainer.documentation: A container for resource data. The container takes only one of the following supported resource data types: ''LocalDeviceResourceData'', ''LocalVolumeResourceData'', ''SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceData'', ''S3MachineLearningModelResourceData''.

ResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a resource definition version.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

S3Uri.documentation: The URI of the source model in an S3 bucket. The model package must be in tar.gz or .zip format.

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define an S3 machine learning resource.

S3UrlSignerRole.documentation: The IAM Role that Greengrass will use to create pre-signed URLs pointing towards the update artifact.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

SageMakerJobArn.documentation: The ARN of the SageMaker training job that represents the source model.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.documentation: Attributes that define an SageMaker machine learning resource.

SoftwareToUpdate.documentation: The piece of software on the Greengrass core that will be updated.

Source.documentation: The source of the subscription. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

Target.documentation: Where the message is sent to. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

SubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a subscription definition version.

UpdateAgentLogLevel.documentation: The minimum level of log statements that should be logged by the OTA Agent during an update.

Message.documentation: A message about the connectivity info update request.

Version.documentation: The new version of the connectivity info.

CoreDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the core definition.

DeviceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the device definition.

FunctionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the Lambda function definition.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the AWS Greengrass group.

CertificateAuthorityExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate authority expires, in milliseconds.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the group certificate configuration.
The ID of the AWS Greengrass group.

LoggerDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the logger definition.

ResourceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the resource definition.

SubscriptionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the subscription definition.

UpdateTargets.documentation: The ARNs of the targets (IoT things or IoT thing groups) that this update will be applied to.

UpdateTargetsArchitecture.documentation: The architecture of the cores which are the targets of an update.

UpdateTargetsOperatingSystem.documentation: The operating system of the cores which are the targets of an update.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the version was created.

Version.documentation: The unique ID of the version.

documentation: AWS Greengrass seamlessly extends AWS onto physical devices so they can act locally on the data they generate, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and durable storage. AWS Greengrass ensures your devices can respond quickly to local events and operate with intermittent connectivity. AWS Greengrass minimizes the cost of transmitting data to the cloud by allowing you to author AWS Lambda functions that execute locally.
